DOC.brief_title: Comparison Oxidative Stress Changes Different Ventilation Strategies During Gynecologic Laparoscopic Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Pneumoperitoneum laparoscopic procedure greatly impair splanchnic blood flow due compression . Increased intra-abdominal pressure may elevate diaphragm , increase intra-thoracic pressure , reduce functional residual capacity , thus lead atelectasis . In collapsed lung , blood flow decrease reperfusion injury may subsequently occur re-expansion lung . This ischemia-reperfusion injury result formation reactive oxygen specie ( ROS ) , highly reactive intermediate oxygen metabolism . When imbalance ROS generation removal antioxidative mechanism , oxidative stress occur eventually cause cellular organ damage . Oxidative stress mediates tissue injury may represent important link laparoscopy clinical side effect . Malondialdehyde ( MDA ) consider reliable marker oxidative stress clinical setting . It breakdown product lipid peroxidation tissue . An elevated concentration MDA reflect level lipid peroxidation . Although abundant data compare effect VCV PCV laparoscopic surgery , time course change oxidative stress two mode elucidate . Therefore , aim study compare alteration oxidative stress two different ventilation mode , VCV PCV , gynecologic laparoscopic surgery . To end , investigator establish prospective randomize clinical study measure plasma level lipid peroxidation marker different stage . Fifty-two patient ASA physical status I II randomly assign receive either VCV PCV laparoscopic gynecologic surgery . DOC.criteria: age 20 70 year BMI < 30 kg/m2 schedule laparoscopic gynecologic surgery require least 1 hour pneumoperitoneum cardiopulmonary disease history sepsis shock , finding suspicious malignant disease , previous major abdominal operation , smoking , recent antioxidant use ( i.e . vitamins A , C E ) .
